channel.title: 639 - MySQL Fail - 639
channel.description:
So I fail at MySQL hence ^
And I figured I did everything right, but is there something im missing? I got rid of alot of the errors but this is what I got left.
[CODE][Cache] Loading cache... [Cache] Loaded cache! [MapXTEA] Loaded 1502 map XTEA key(s) [PacketManager] Loading packet handlers... [PacketManager] Loaded 60 packet handlers. java.sql.SQLException: Must specify port after ':' in connection string at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:1075) at at org.dementhium.model.World.<clinit>(World.java:72) at org.dementhium.RS2ServerBootstrap.main(RS2ServerBootstrap.java:56) [World] Loading World... item.title: 639 - MySQL Fail - 639
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Perhaps you need jdbc:mysql:// for all of them, instead of http://? not sure.

Read full topic

item.title: 639 - MySQL Fail - 639
item.dc:creator: @Eclipse634 Eclipse634
item.description:
@Eclipse634 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:12, topic:422391”][quote author=Eclipse634 link=topic=525060.msg3822796#msg3822796 date=1321920282]
It’s called in PlayerLoader, Highscores, and PlayerCount classes.

It’s called lyke this:

public PlayerLoader() { try { database = DatabaseManager.create("http://eclipse639.com:3306", "HIDDEN", "HIDDEN", "HIDDEN"); database.establishConnection(); } catch (SQLException e) {
[/quote]
lyke? You’ve got to be fucking kidding me.

Check all three, make sure they have the port, and an endslash.[/quote]

I use lyke on accident, I had a broken I key on my phone for the longest and I always had to replace I’s with Y’s. Became a force of habit.

But O.T. I checked them all, they all have end slashes and ports.

Read full topic

item.title: 639 - MySQL Fail - 639

item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

So, what calls DatabaseManager.create?

item.title: 639 - MySQL Fail - 639
item.dc:creator: @Eclipse634 Eclipse634
item.description:
@Eclipse634 wrote:

[code]public class DatabaseManager {

private static Driver driver;

public static DatabaseManager create(String host, String database, String username, String password) throws SQLException {
	if (driver == null) {
		driver = new Driver();
	}
	return new DatabaseManager(host, database, username, password);
}

private String host;
private String database;
private String username;
private String password;

private Connection connection;
private Statement statement;

private DatabaseManager(String host, String database, String username, String password) {
	this.host = host;
	this.database = database;
	this.username = username;
	this.password = password;
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.description:

connection = DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:mysql://" + host + "/" + database + "?jdbcCompliantTruncation=false", username, password);

@Eclipse634 wrote:

I already understand the error. I just don’t understand which file it’s coming from as it does not specify

I’ve searched in all my files containing anything SQL related and added a port E.G.
ForumIntegration.java

I changed everything relating to sql to have a port. I dont get it.
